body:
@tombergan:

> You could make an argument that Go needs a better package management system

That's already being discussed and over discussed, at some point we will have it, which by the looks of it will be sooner rather than later.

> and perhaps an NPM-like entity to register and preserve packages. 

Nope, never have, never will. There are sufficient ways to address this, including and not limited to vendoring. Currently vendoring doesn't work nicely with libraries but a package manager would flatten the said dependencies and then the problem would disappear.

> For better or worse, Go's current package management system is (partially) controlled by environment variables (GOROOT and GOPATH). Adding a third variable (GOPKGALIASES) is a quick and simple solution that doesn't seem too offensive to me in the grand scheme of things.

Not needed, see above.
